article.headline: Tullow Oil says has $500M liquidity headroom
article.body: Tullow Oil PLC said Wednesday that it retains $500 million of liquidity headroom of undrawn facilities and free cash at the start of the fourth quarter of 2020. The London-listed oil-and-gas company said the financial position is deemed appropriate given its capital commitments. The announcement follows the completion of Tullow's biannual redetermination of its RBL credit facility, with $1.8 billion debt approved by the lending syndicate. Tullow last month warned of a potential liquidity shortfall by April 2022 and said it would need to negotiate a financial restructuring with its creditors.
